group_1.textRight: Even though the war's settled and all,
the famine is still going on.

group_1.textLeft: And if we purchase food from other regions,@then our farmers will go unpaid...

group_1.textRight: What if this keeps going for another year?

group_1.textLeft: There may be a mounting drive for us@to expand our territory…

group_1.textRight: But you don't wanna fight other countries,@do you?

group_1.textLeft: I believe we should instead expand our ports@and trade while we're still able.
We must prepare for all eventualities.

group_1.textRight: Your clan has been really taking the lead@these days, huh?
It'd be awful handy if the current Lord Sumiya@was gone so you guys could take over again.
Then the whole country'll be united@just like you want.

group_1.textLeft: Sumiya will never abdicate his position,@and Mizuna has no intention of rebellion.
Even if we are trusted again and have a voice@in proceedings now,
if we as outsiders betray them, we will be@done away with in an instant…

group_1.textRight: Still, you don't like the idea of pillaging other@lands because of our lack of food, right?
So if you just tell them that,@they'll understand, right?

group_1.textLeft: While it may be the right thing to say,@I doubt it will turn out the way we hope.

group_1.textRight: Anyway, are you doing the rice tax@inspection today?

group_1.textLeft: No, we already have an estimate of how@the harvest fared,
so I thought I'd go and confirm the sum@of the final yield instead.
I'll also inform the farmers that they won't@need to repay our seed loans.

group_1.textRight: Hey, something's going on over there.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, something's not right.@Let us make haste!
